user.title: Enter credentials
user.description:
Enter your username and password for your Google account (leaving the token field blank). Please ensure you are using an app password; you can create one at https://myaccount.google.com/apppasswords.

Logging in with a username and password may fail with certain library versions. If this happens, you can login with your username and token that you have manually retrieved instead (leaving the password field blank). See [Readme]({invalid_auth_url}) for details.

options.title: Configure options
options.description: Choose which lists to synchronize and optionally add a prefix to the list names in Home Assistant.

data_description.list_prefix: (Optional, can be blank) Add a unique identifier to the front of each list name in Home Assistant. For example, entering 'Google' will display your shopping list as 'Google Shopping List'. Leave empty to have the lists named as they are in Google Keep.
data_description.list_auto_sort: If checked, all of your selected lists will be changed to be sorted alphabetically. This is bidirectional, so your lists in both Home Assistant and Google Keep will be sorted.

reauth_confirm.title: Reauthenticate
reauth_confirm.description: The Google Keep Sync integration needs to re-authenticate your account.

init.title: Configure options
init.description: Choose which lists to synchronize and optionally add a prefix to the list names in Home Assistant.

data_description.list_prefix: (Optional, can be blank) Add a unique identifier to the front of each list name in Home Assistant. For example, entering 'Google' will display your shopping list as 'Google Shopping List'. Leave empty to have the lists named as they are in Google Keep.
data_description.list_auto_sort: If checked, all of your selected lists will be changed to be sorted alphabetically. This is bidirectional, so your lists in both Home Assistant and Google Keep will be sorted.

error.list_fetch_error: An error occurred while fetching lists
